ResearchProjectDef.label: Clockwork Principle
ResearchProjectDef.description: By developing an understanding of timed gears and springs, one can achieve the earliest form of industrialization. This includes the crafting of various mechanical components for the creation of basic and crude machinery which will serve as the first step towards efficient industrial automation.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
Welcome to Project RimFactory Beta!

We invite you on a trip through automation, starting with wood and coal fueled smelters and advancing through AI-controlled self-improving assemblers.

General Usage: Store materials in the white designation Input area for the machine to consume. After a bit of work, the machine will place the finished product on it's yellow Output tile.

The oldest known clockwork machine is the Antikythera mechanism, found in 1901 in a shipwreck dated at 50BC and Greek in origin. A series of 30 gears was used to predict eclipses and other astronomical phenomenon as well as the passage of years. Advanced clockwork mechanisms reached new heights in Europe during the 1800s, and even today automation without computers is used in industry.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Euler's Identity
ResearchProjectDef.description: The pinnacle of mathematical beauty, this paradoxical equation introduces the user to the earliest form of automated machinery. This will also permit the crafting of basic machine frames for use in construction of automated machines.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Leonard Euler developed mathematical systems for intemacractions between physics, geometry and algebra.\nWith these formulas, automated production of basic materials such as stone bricks and simple art is possible.\nPlace items within the white designation for the bills to consume, they will be output to the adjustable green tile

ResearchProjectDef.label: Machine Learning
ResearchProjectDef.description: Although most machines are generally limited in capability, the creation of self-learning computers through the designing of complex programming algorithms will allow machines to learn on their own and automatically correct on flaws that present themselves within a program. This is a prime example of early artificial intelligence.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Although early forms of machinery operated based on the fixed movement of gears and pistons, the idea of a machine that could mimic the abstract reasoning of the human mind through complex mathematical algorithms was not new at all.\n\nThe term was coined by Arthur Samuel during the latter 1950's, but the idea was conceptualized by Alan Turing in 1950. To summarize this concept, a machine must first be given data models developed by humans to understand an objective and then use those given models to create possible future predictions.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Binary System
ResearchProjectDef.description: A mathematical expression using only 1's and 0's. Standardizing computers by using this simple yet versatile language will exponentially expand computation performance and will allow one to create far more advanced forms of artificial intelligence.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Like humans, machines must use language to communicate amongst programs and one another.\n\nSystems relating to binary can be traced back to the ancient world in places such as China, India, and Egypt. Although used in various ways, the modern binary system can be credited to Thomas Harriot, Juan Caramuel y Lobkowitz, and Gottfried Leibniz, who developed and formalized the system during the 16th and 17th centuries.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Quantum Bit technology
ResearchProjectDef.description: Leveraging the quantum nature of reality itself to solve exponentially more demanding computational problems.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: The studying of microscopic systems including atoms and the process of computing information in the quantum system will allow one to access greater levels of precision in computer science and create more complex pieces of machinery. The founding of quantum hypothesis can be credited to Max Planck during the early 20th century, who first conceptualized his theory upon working on the black-body radiation problem by Gustav Kirchhoff.
